name: Troubleshoot Permission Issues in Kubernetes Pod.txt - Some of the commonly faced issues while using KIAM:
description: This section outlines some common issues that users may encounter while using KIAM (Kubernetes IAM Authenticator Module) to manage permissions and access to AWS resources from within Kubernetes pods. It lists three specific problems: inability to locate credentials, unauthorized errors when trying to access AWS resources, and permission issues despite having the necessary KIAM annotations set on the pod or namespace. These issues can arise due to misconfiguration, incorrect permissions, or other factors related to the integration between Kubernetes and AWS IAM.
use_cases: Managing permissions and access to AWS resources from within Kubernetes pods
Troubleshooting authentication and authorization issues with KIAM
Integrating Kubernetes with AWS IAM for secure access to cloud resources

name: Troubleshoot Permission Issues in Kubernetes Pod.txt - How do we troubleshoot the problem?
description: This section explains the steps to troubleshoot permission issues faced by a Kubernetes pod when accessing AWS resources. It suggests using the iam-troubleshooter feature in Jarvis, checking the required permissions in the IAM role, and raising a PR or ticket if permissions are missing. If the issue persists despite correct permissions, it could be related to KIAM (Kubernetes IAM Authenticator) and requires further investigation.
use_cases: Troubleshooting permission issues for Kubernetes pods accessing AWS resources
Verifying and managing IAM role permissions for Kubernetes pods
Investigating KIAM-related issues when accessing AWS resources from Kubernetes pods
capabilities: PR and ticket creation for missing permissions

name: Troubleshoot Permission Issues in Kubernetes Pod.txt - How do we fix the problem?
description: This section explains how to fix the permission issues faced by applications running in Kubernetes pods. It recommends migrating from KIAM (Kubernetes IAM Authenticator) to Service Accounts (SA) for accessing AWS IAM roles. The migration is suggested as a permanent solution to stabilize the applications and resolve the permission-related problems.
use_cases: Resolving permission issues in Kubernetes pods
Migrating from KIAM to Service Accounts for accessing AWS IAM roles
Stabilizing applications running in Kubernetes pods
Providing a permanent solution for permission-related problems
capabilities: Accessing IAM roles via Service Accounts
Migrating from KIAM to Service Accounts
Referring to documentation for migration steps
Reaching out to DevOps for assistance
